channel.title: Is this really how people think?
channel.description:
http://www.worldstarhiphop.com/videos/e/16711680/wshhUtl06mRPj1O8LBR8
Like are people really that stupid? Or was this video set up?
Looks pretty real, and I find it funny that like 75% of the people do not even know who our Vice President is.

item.title: Is this really how people think?
item.dc:creator: @Vexx Vexx
item.description:
@Vexx wrote:

My political science teacher showed me this. There were a lot of people with correct answers but the people who made the video only took the funny ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this really how people think?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:15, topic:431784”]@chillwitm888

I can’t believe our public schools have failed that horribly…

Dr. Martin Luther King was one of the biggest things to happen to America… And they don’t even know about it. Such a shame…[/quote]

I wouldn’t say the public schools failed horribly. Those were two videos from the west coast, everyone on the west coast is an idiotic pothead. Look at drub…

I must honestly say that I don’t know the capital of Washington but I know the capital of Virginia, Richmond.

item.title: Is this really how people think?
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:12, topic:431784”][quote author=LilXCj link=topic=534488.msg3907727#msg3907727 date=1328397901]
I don’t know who the Vice P is (I’ve already forgotten after watching this video), but that’s because I don’t care for our current government; however, the basics of our countries history and geography should have been easy for these people.
[/quote]

You don’t care for the current Government because they are doing a horrible job, which is all more reason for you to pay attention. The reason we study history is so we don’t let history repeat itself. You should learn what they are doing and so you can fight against it possibly in the future.[/quote]

I understand this point, but I’ve given up on trying to change the monopoly that is called the “run for president”. Simply my opinion. I don’t want facts shoved down my throat. Maybe I’ll care a bit more after college and it starts effecting me drastically.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this really how people think?

item.title: Is this really how people think?
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

LilXCj:

I don’t know who the Vice P is (I’ve already forgotten after watching this video), but that’s because I don’t care for our current government; however, the basics of our countries history and geography should have been easy for these people.

You don’t care for the current Government because they are doing a horrible job, which is all more reason for you to pay attention. The reason we study history is so we don’t let history repeat itself. You should learn what they are doing and so you can fight against it possibly in the future.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this really how people think?

item.title: Is this really how people think?
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

Not Exactly Rocket Science – 14 Jul 11

The extended mind – how Google affects our memories - Not Exactly Rocket...

Information has never been easier to find or record. Within seconds, the Internet lets us find answers to questions that would have remained elusive just a few decades ago. We don’t even have to remember the answers – we can just look them up again....

item.title: Is this really how people think?
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“m1lkman, post:8, topic:431784”][quote author=Spades link=topic=534488.msg3907580#msg3907580 date=1328387872]
Like almost all of them didn’t even know how many stars were on our flag, or how many states we have… When I was in Elementary School I knew this stuff. I had been watching all the political stuff since 2000 when George Bush was going to run. I caught an interest there, and this just amazes me… These are High School students and they don’t know the basic history of our Country. They couldn’t even tell how many countries boarders ours. The one kid said “There’s too many.” You can’t count to 2?
[/quote]

Depressing isn’t it? Yet they all know how to text.[/quote]

You know, it’s probably the same people saying “Obama for president! 2012!” But they don’t even know who our Vice President is.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this really how people think?

item.title: Is this really how people think?
item.dc:creator: @m1lkman m1lkman
item.description:
@m1lkman wrote:

Spades:

Like almost all of them didn’t even know how many stars were on our flag, or how many states we have… When I was in Elementary School I knew this stuff. I had been watching all the political stuff since 2000 when George Bush was going to run. I caught an interest there, and this just amazes me… These are High School students and they don’t know the basic history of our Country. They couldn’t even tell how many countries boarders ours. The one kid said “There’s too many.” You can’t count to 2?

Depressing isn’t it? Yet they all know how to text.

Read full topic
